title: The Copper-Wire Tangle
description: A metallic nest in the scrapyard is generating a dangerous static field...

turns.narrative: The city scrapyard is vibrating. A mass of discarded 'Copper-Wire' has braided itself into a giant, metallic nest.
turns.convergence: The nest hums with a frequency that makes your skin tingle with static electricity. It smells of hot metal and grease.

turns.narrative: A 'Wire-Serpent'—a ten-foot snake made of braided copper and brass—slithers out of the nest, its tongue a literal spark of mana.
turns.choice_b: Ground the serpent with an iron rod
turns.convergence: The serpent's strike hits the iron rod, sending a surge of blue light into the ground. It chitters like a broken radio.

turns.narrative: The serpent is trying to protect a 'Power-Core' at the center of the nest—a device that was meant to power the 'Bio-Ward' before the Scourge.
turns.choice_b: Distract the serpent with a battery
turns.convergence: The serpent eats the battery and glows bright orange, its movements becoming twice as fast.

turns.narrative: The scrapyard floor is becoming magnetized. Metal scraps are flying toward the nest, creating an 'Iron-Armor' for the serpent.
turns.convergence: The iron scraps fall, but the serpent now has a 'Magnetic-Bite' that can pull the weapon from your hand.

turns.narrative: The 'Junk-King'—a man wearing a crown of gears—emerges from the shadows. 'She’s just trying to stay warm!' he shouts.
turns.convergence: He reveals the serpent is a 'Construct-Mother' for all the tiny machines in the city.

turns.narrative: You must find a way to 'Pacify' the mother-vibration. The air is thick with the smell of scorched air and old gasoline.
turns.convergence: The serpent's glow fades to a soft, steady copper-light. The nest begins to unbraid itself.

turns.narrative: The Junk-King gives you a 'Copper-Tooth'—a charm that allows you to talk to 'Simple-Machines'.
turns.convergence: The tooth is warm and tastes faintly of copper in your mouth. It allows you to unlock 'Basic-Tool' secrets.

turns.narrative: The Scrapyard is quiet, the static finally gone. The King promises to keep the serpent 'safe' in a lead-lined bunker.
turns.convergence: The sun sets over the junk-heaps, making them look like a city of jagged gold and rust.

turns.narrative: As you leave, a small gear-bug follows you for a few steps before clicking its legs and scurrying back to the King.
turns.convergence: The air feels remarkably clear. Your hair is no longer standing on end.

turns.narrative: Quest ends in the Scrapyard. The 'Copper-Wire Tangle' is now a 'Copper-Wire Friend'.

conclusion: The mission regarding 'The Copper-Wire Tangle' is complete. Quest Complete.

risk_matrix.penalty: You are electrocuted into a pile of scrap. (Quest Failed)
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Scrapyard workers report static shocks and flying metal

permanent_effects.settlement: Scrapyard safe; Power-Core potentially reclaimed for Bio-Ward
